fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to copy an image from an HTML file, the image is healthily copied to the editing mode but gets changed to a "Broken Image" image on the old editing experience.
On the new one, the image is just not copied or copied with failure to the editor and gets removed when publishing the page.

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an HTML file with an image on it;
# From the rendered HTML file, copy all the content and paste it into a draft page (you can use the attached sample);
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The image is pasted correctly in the page and is shown on the published version. 

h3. Actual Results
*Old editing experience*: the image changes to a "Broken Image" image.
*New editing experience*: the image disappears.

h3. Workaround
Save the image on your local computer and then use the own editor's feature to upload the image on the page.
fields.summary: Cannot copy image from HTML page to Confluence editor

fields.summary: Visio files incorrectly rendered on Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using {{content.id}} in a {{dynamicContentMacros}} as such:

{code}
"dynamicContentMacros": [
  {
      "url": "/hello-world?contentId={content.id}",
      "key": "anne-dynamic-macro",
      "name": {
          "value": "Anne Dynamic Macro"
      },
      "categories": ["media"],
      "outputType": "block",
      "bodyType": "rich-text",
      "featured": true,
      "width": "100%",
      
}
{code}

and adding the macro in template, {{content.id}} is 0 when viewing the template: http://recordit.co/GSqeVsJCOK

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an macro app with {{content.id}} as context parameters in URL
# Create a template with the macro in the new editor
# Click on publish and view the template
# Notice that {{content.id}} is zero:
 !Snip20190701_12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Return {{content.id}} as template's id
h3. Actual Results
Zero is returned as {{content.id}}

h3. Notes
* Context parameter content.id works with pages and blogs
* Same issue with body and bodiless macros - content.id is 0 instead of entityId (which is essentially a template id)
* I've informed app developer that content.* context parameters are only available in pages, blogs, and custom content:
{quote}
From https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/context-parameters/ , the content.* parameters are only available on these conditions:

Confluence provides the content.* variables wherever a page, blog post, or custom content is present. Some examples are viewing or editing a page / blog post, or viewing a Confluence Question.
{quote}

h3. Background
From app developer:
{quote}
No, this never worked, but in my opinion it should pass the entityId for the template as content id, like it does for the pages and blogposts.

Otherwise it is impossible to render the 3rd party macros, as we have no idea what is the rendering contents (context) and what to render.

This is especially critical now, with the introduction of a fabric editor, as it attempts to call a "live preview" for the macro, but provides no context
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Context content.id is 0 when a macro is used in the template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating and inserting a new Gliffy diagram immediately after an Info panel macro breaks the page and inhibits further editing. Additionally, *+the page's content is not longer visible+*, however, content is still intact in the backend database.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Insert an Info panel macro
 # Immediately below the Info panel, insert a new Gliffy diagram
 # In the Gliffy editor, create a new diagram and publish it
 # Return to Confluence
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

Page is published and the Gliffy macro is rendered beneath the Info panel macro
h3. Actual Results

Page is published, but upon refreshing the following happens:

# Page content no longer visible.
# error is displayed:
{quote}*We couldn't display your content*

Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists contact Atlassian Support
{quote}
In addition, attempting to edit the page now also fails.
{quote}*We couldn't load the editor.*

Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists contact Atlassian Support
{quote}
h3. Notes

The Gliffy diagram is published and is added as an attachment to the page. It can be downloaded from the page or referenced by a Gliffy macro on another page.

h3. Workaround

Avoid placing new Gliffy diagrams directly beneath Info panel macros. Inserting a Divider macro immediately after the Info panel macro and before the Gliffy diagram appears to prevent the issue from occurring.
fields.summary: Inserting a new Gliffy diagram after an Info panel macro breaks the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It would be useful for some users to have an additional Space permission, regarding reordering pages, where just certain users would be able to reorder pages on a space, avoiding messing up the organization of the page tree.

Use case {quote}It would be nice if things like this and title changes could have a separate user permission, and if they were tracked in the articles history. We have historic links on some user forums and by moving the articles those links break.{quote}

h3. Expected Results
Additional permissions/restrictions to allow/prevent users from reordering pages on the page tree. (besides the already existing Admin permission)
fields.summary: Page reorder permission / restriction

Users can't copy the table only and cannot work separately on the tables which are created/used inside the ToC Zone macro
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
It is now possible to edit the height, width X and Y coordinates of an object in Gliffy. Allow to view and edit coordinates of the central point of the object. E.g. for a rectangle with height 21 and width 51 the placed on X=10 and Y=30 center point is CX=10+(51-1)/2=35, CY=30+(21-1)/2=40. For rectangle 20 points height and 50 points width located on the same position the cordinates of the center point are CX=10+(50-1)/2=34.5, CY=30+(20-1)/2=39.5. So allow the ½.

There is a place right of the angle edit box in object properties.
fields.summary: Allow to view and edit coordination of Center point of an object in Gliffy

fields.description:
If a Jira Service Desk portal-only customer (unlicensed user) tries to access an article that contains a Team Calendar in an integrated Knowledge Base, the user can see the calendar but not its events.

This happens because Team Calendar will check if users are licensed.

If the Confluence space is public (allowing anonymous access), and a non-logged in customer accesses the article through the Knowledge Base, the Team Calendar events display correctly.
 !print.png|thumbnail!

If the customer (that doesn't have a Confluence license) logs into the customer portal, they see the calendar (and a 401 error) but stop seeing the events.
 !print2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion:

Start considering Jira Service Desk portal-only customer as Anonymous access, so they can see calendar events in KB articles.
fields.summary: Allow Jira Service Desk customers to view Team Calendar events in Knowledge Base articles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence when the user creates an anchor in order to be able to click on a link and be redirected to a specific part of the page, if the same is being retrieved by using a *Page Properties Report* macro (that will carry content from the original Page Properties macro), it will not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to create a new page using the *Page Properties macro* and insert content inside the same. It's required to create tables to insert the content, so it will be displayed on the target page.
# In addition to the random content, make sure to add a link pointing to an anchor and insert this anchor *outside of the page properties macro*
# Put a label on this page, so it will be used later, on the target page.
# Publish the page
# Now, create a second page and insert the *Page properties report* macro and make sure to point it to the previously created page
# Publish the new page
# Tap the link that would redirect you to the anchor outside of the macro

h3. Expected Results
The link should redirect the user to the target page, at the specific part of the same.

h3. Actual Results
Tapping the link will do nothing. Only the URL will change to point to the anchor.

h3. Notes

* If you put the anchor *inside* the Page Properties macro, it will work on the target page.
* When observing the phenomenon, the URL changes to be adapted to the anchor, but, the page ID remains the same.

h3. Workaround

* Put the anchor *inside* the page properties macro so the link will redirect it to the correct location.
* Manually copy the URL that would work with the anchor, on the original page and then, paste it on the *Web link* option. This way, it will redirect the user to the correct location on the page.
fields.summary: Anchors do not work inside Page Properties macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have more than one Code Block macro on a page and both use the numbering column, in case one of the macros is using the Dark theme, it will change the theme from the other macro on the numbering column.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Old Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add two *Code Block* macros to a page and insert a dummy code (like "hello world" stuff);
# On both macros, allow the *Show line numbers* option;
# Select one of the macros and change the theme to *RDark*;
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The page is published and each macro has a different theme.

h3. Actual Results
The macro which you did not change the theme gets its numbering column with the dark theme from the other macro.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code Block macro changes the theme for the numbering column in other Code Block macros on the same page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue raised by Service Rocket.

When Expand Macro used within Tab macro, it results to a `ReferenceError` of `_skate`

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Install "Composition Add-on". (Installation endpoint: added as an internal comment.
2. Create a new page *(old editor)*
3. Add the `Tab Group Macro`, then add `Tab Macro` within the body of `Tab Group Macro`.
4. Add the `Expand Macro` within the `Tab` body with some content.
5. Publish the page.
6. Click the `Expand macro` to expand the content.

* Expand fails
!Expand failed.png|thumbnail!  
* Expand successful
!Expand successfully.png|thumbnail!  
* Missing scope
!Missing scope.png|thumbnail! 
* _skate required expand macro
!__skate required for expand macro.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
The `Expand macro` should always expand when clicked revealing the content in the body of the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The `Expand macro` doesn't expand when clicked to reveal the content in the body of the macro intermittently.

h3. Notes
* I've not personally replicated this as all my dev instances are migrated to the new editor. I'm moving this here for more expertise

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Expand macro functionality failing due to intermittent absence of local scope "__skate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After setting a space as a homepage, going directly to the server base URL such as https://foo.atlassian.net/wiki seems to redirect users to the Activity page: https://foo.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates\\ 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator of Confluence, go to *Settings > Further configuration* and set one of the spaces in Confluence to be the homepage 
# *Save* the configuration
# Access the server base URL directly - https://foo.atlassian.net/wiki

h3. Expected Results
Users will be redirected to the custom homepage.

h3. Actual Results
User is redirected to the "Activity" page.

h3. Notes
Clicking on the site logo will actually redirect the user to the homepage if the user has just accessed the homepage. If the user has recently accessed other pages like "Activity" or "Your Work", using the logo will redirect the same to these pages, as Confluence stores the last section from them in order to be attributed to the logo.

h3. Workaround
* Manually tap the homepage on the sidebar from the dashboard. 
* If the user has accessed the new homepage after the other options from the dashboard, tapping the site logo will do the trick.
fields.summary: Server base URL redirects to activity page instead of the homepage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, if the user restricts a page for groups with an uppercase letter, members of the group will not be able to find the page in macros like page tree macros and child macros.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a *site-admin* of the application, make sure to create a new group that will be using uppercase letters through [https://site.atlassian.net/admin]. For example, "testiNG".
 # With the created group (and also, the *Application Access* granted for the same, if needed), make sure to add specific users to the same.
 # Add group restriction to a page with above group
 # Add a page tree macro to display the above page mentioned in 3
 # Ask one of the group member to access the above page with the macro on it

h3. Expected Results

The person from the group should be able to view/edit the macro with that restricted page

 
h3. Actual Results

The person from the group can't see the restricted page in the macro:

 

 
h3. Notes

The query used to validate permission doesn't take into account the uppercase/lowercase of group names. Functionality wise it should be case insensitive.
h3. Workaround

Add the user in restriction individually, or add user to lowercase groups
fields.summary: Restricted pages do not display in macros

fields.description:
Hi.

The existing functionality for linking to a new page is:
 * Type the text that will act as the link.
 * Select the text
 * Click on the 'insert link' icon
 * Enter the new page name
 * Hit 'Insert'.
 * +*_Publish the page you're editing._*+
 * *_Click on the link to navigate to the new page_***

The new page now exists and is ready to edit.

The last step of this process is really, really, really a complete pain the arse! It means if I want to create and edit multiple pages under my page, I need to publish and then restart editing multiple times. I ruins my flow, and creates multiple version in the history.

There's no need for this. Hitting 'insert' should create the new page. If you don't want to create it in a Published state, then either open it in Draft in a new tab/window, or just record it as being in Draft.
fields.summary: linking to a new page should create the page immediately

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud have updated Jira gadgets that may affect Confluence - Jira integration. They are having troubles testing the changes in Confluence. So they want the Confluence team to help them test it. 
h3. More details from the team

Hi,
  
 We're working on the following issue:
 [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACG-16]
 In short: we have to change implementation of HttpClientFetcher to use outbound proxy mechanism.
 We implemented it and tested on Jira Cloud:
 [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-cloud-gadgets/pull-requests/90/issue-kitkat-1430-outbound-proxy]
  
 We spend a lot of time and encountered a lot of problems when we wanted to test gadgets (with or without our modifications) in Confluence Cloud. Unfortunately we're not able to spend more time on it.
  
 Could you test our solution and provide feedback for the following questions:
 # Does Confluence build and run smoothly with our changes without enabling the below FF?
 # Do Gadgets work properly with on our code when you set FF "gadgets.opensocial.http-client-fetcher.outbound.proxy" = *true*?

Please take into account that checking FF value is provided by DarkFeatureManager, which checks the value once (on startup, from system properties). Therefore if you want to enable our changes locally you need to provide it from system properties or just set isOutboundProxyEnabled() to return true manually in the code.
  
 If you confirmed that our changes are safe for Confluence then we will roll out it for Jira. Then we will share all of our results and conclusions with you to make yours rollout easier.
  
 Regards,
 Luke
h3. Environment

 
h3. Steps to Test 

I have spoken with Leo on how we could help them test this. Here are the steps:

 
 # Get connie launcher working on green_master (conf + jira instance)
 # Test gadgets (edit page -> macro browser -> insert a jira gadget ^)
 # Checkout their branch on atlassian-cloud-gadgets and build it
 # Bump `<atlassian.gadgets.version>5.1.48-SNAPSHOT</atlassian.gadgets.version>` to the built jar version in the confluence root pom file
 # bin/vertigo build -r && bin/vertigo restart
 # Ensure the version is bumped: `/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/manage/all` and find the gadget plugin version
 # Test gadgets
 # Enable the dark feature they mentioned `confluence-core/confluence/src/etc/java/darkfeature.properties`
 # Check that it’s enabled `/wiki/admin/darkfeatures.action`
 # Test gadgets

h3. Expected Results

Jira Gadgets are working as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Currently they haven't been able to test the gadgets integration
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Test Jira Gadgets changes in Confluence
Create integration test for Flag requests from Connect Macros

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the administrator configures the application to use a custom default homepage, the same will be displayed on the sidebar, but, the user will still be redirected to the All Activites by default. However, if the same select the "Activites tab", or, "Your Work", the next time that the same clicks on the Confluence logo (to be redirected to the dashboard), it will redirect the user to the last option that was selected, including the new custom homepage.

This is a suggestion to always make the new configured page to become the default one as this can impact on the usability for external users, or, even anonymous users that will not be redirected to the custom homepage
fields.summary: User should be always redirected to custom Homepage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When calling the *Team Calendars* macro, besides it doesn't auto populate the search results (CONFCLOUD-65260 - Team calendar macro on the new editor doesn't auto-populate in search), it doesn't find the calendar and it is not possible to insert the calendar in the page.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 * New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the Team Calendars up and running on your instance;
 # Create a calendar 'Banana', as an example;
 # Add a random event called 'Banana Event', just to have something populated on it;
 # Create a new page (it can be on the same space as the calendar);
 # Call the */team calendars* macro and manually type the full calendar name;
 # Insert the macro and publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The calendar gets embedded on the page, showing all of its events (the Banana Event).
h3. Actual Results

A blank calendar is shown *OR* the macro just keeps loading (in case you typed the calendar name wrong)
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, it has been confirmed that that the user can paste the calendar ID on the calendar field (for example, 2307a1bb-a01b-4b23-a470-5783d8b8e29b):
 # Select 'Calendars', locate the calendar you wish to embed into a page, select "Embed" from the calendars context menu, and copy the URL provided
 # On the URL, make sure to only copy the ID (in our example, 2307a1bb-a01b-4b23-a470-5783d8b8e29b)
 # Open a page and include the  "team calendars" macro
 # Paste the ID on the "Calendar" field
 # Tap the preview button and then, save the configuration.

*Note*
 Once the calendar is added to the Page using the Workaround, each time after editing the page calendar keeps Spinning, refreshing the page resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Cannot embed Team Calendars with Team Calendars macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to use the label keyboard shortcut ("L") to retrieve the labels window, the same will open two windows to insert the labels. This will avoid any labels to be added or removed, as the buttons and options will not do anything.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page using any editor and make sure to add the [Attachments macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html].
# Publish the page
# Now that the page has been created, make sure to insert an attachment to the macro by dragging and dropping it, or, using the upload option. This is important as the bug will not be reproduced if there are no attachments on the page.
# Tap "L" on the keyboard while looking at the page

h3. Expected Results
A single window to insert/remove labels should be displayed, allowing the user to properly interact with them.

h3. Actual Results

Two label windows are opened and although the user can write on the labels search box (the one behind the same, using the new look), nothing will happen when using the buttons.

h3. Notes
* The user must make sure to add attachments to the macro. Otherwise, the bug will not be triggered.
* Both windows seem to be from different versions.

h3. Workaround
Tap the labels icon to have the window properly open, or, edit the page and tap the labels icon.
fields.summary: Using keyboard shortcut will not work for labels if a page contains an Attachment macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When third-party developers release updates to their apps these updates aren't automatically installed on any Cloud sites that have them installed.
h3. Suggested Solution
Updates released to third-party apps should be automatically installed as soon as released.
[UPM documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/updating-apps-273875710.html] says there is an option to enable automatic updates, but this option is not available on Cloud applications.
h3. Why this is important
These new versions might contain fixes to critical security vulnerabilities.
h3. Workaround 
Go to the Manage Apps page and manually install the update.
fields.summary: Provide option to automatically update apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a file list page, there is a field for restrictions.
Adding a user there does not seem to perform any restrictions on the page or the file
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-24 at 3.21.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on + on the left navigation bar
 # Search for file list page
# Proceed to add a user in the restriction field

h3. Expected Results
Either the page or the file added will be restricted for users

h3. Actual Results
No restrictions applied

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restrictions on a file list page does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we link an image to a user profile, the image will disappear from the page and be replaced by a mention for that user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach an image
# Select the image and click on *Link*
# On *Search*, search for a user and select it
# *Insert* the link
# *Publish* the page

h3. Expected Results
The image should link to the user profile

h3. Actual Results
The image is replaced by a mention for that specific user selected
|  [^link_profile_image.mp4]  |

h3. Notes
This only happens on the legacy editor.

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
There're two workarounds available:
* Use the *Profile Picture* macro

OR

* Instead of selecting the user's profile, use the following steps: 
## Select the image
## Choose *Link* 
## Use the *Web Link* option and link directly to the user's profile
fields.summary: Linking a user profile on an image will replace the image by a mention

fields.description:
For some business, it would be useful to enforce a second authentication on certain pages, such as require users to log in a second time when accessing those. This would enable a finer control on which user is viewing sensitive data, and always ensure that that data would be safe behind a second login screen. 

e.g.
{quote}Basically, let's
say I forget to log out from a public computer and someone else uses it
after me, I would want to have a 2nd redundant system to prevent access to
sensitive information. Having a way for a space to ask for my password
again would be a simple way to achieve this goal.{quote}
fields.summary: Require a second time login when viewing certain pages with sensitive data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user tries to use the *Subscribe by URL* option from Team Calendars in order to add new calendar events, the same will provide the following error when trying to insert credentials like username and password:

"*Error reading specified calendar. Please check the user name and password are correct*."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an existing calendar (this can be on the same instance, or, a different one), make sure to tap tap the ellipsis button on the right side of its name and then, select *Edit*
# On the *General* option, copy the *URL* field.
# Now, in a different instance/space, make sure to have Team Calendars installed and then, *create a new calendar* or, go to an existing one.
# There, use the *Subscribe by URL option* and then, add the necessary information
# Insert the username and password on the respective fields

h3. Expected Results
The calendar should allow the content to be subscribed with the user's credentials from the Atlassian Account

h3. Actual Results
A message clarifying that the username and password are incorrect is displayed:

"*Error reading specified calendar. Please check the user name and password are correct*."

h3. Notes
* Some possible causes for this one are that the username and password are tied from the Atlassian Account and not Confluence, or, a possibility of having a different username due to some [GDPR modifications to the usernames|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], hence, not matching the credentials.
* The option to subscribe in existing calendars also does not have actions. If trying to subscribe for a calendar that is added to a page, you will need to *edit* the page and then, by taping on the calendar macro, use the *Add Calendar* button, it will only refresh the screen and no content will be added.

h3. Workaround

If no information is added on the username and password fields, the subscription action will work without any issues.
fields.summary: Subscribing to a calendar by URL does not work if trying to use username/password

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When inserting an iFrame macro inside a Tip macro, and selecting either *Left* and *Right* alignment the displayed webpage won't be wrapped by the Tip macro.
h3. Environment
 * Tip Macro
 * iFrame Macro
 * Old Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a "Tip" macro into the page
 # Inside of if, insert a "iFrame" macro
 # On "Align" drop-down menu select either *Left* or *Right*

h3. Expected Results
 * The page returned by the iFrame to be correctly wrapped by the Tip macro, with a left (or right) alignment.

h3. Actual Results
 * Tip macro won't wrap the webpage as can be seen in the next screenshot:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-21 at 10.20.44.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
 * This behavior only seems to affect *Left* and *Right* alignment, while selecting other alignment options will correctly wrap the webpage.

h3. Workaround
 * Instead of using *Left* and *Right* alignment, select any other alignment options, and the page will be correctly displayed inside the Tip macro
fields.summary: iFrame macro inside a Tip macro won't be correctly wrapped

fields.description:
Currently the Jira issues Macro in Fabric does not allow the same level of customisation, as the TinyMCE editor one, such as the removal of an issue description form a single issue macro.

In order to improve the overall Fabric experience, it would be great if the Jira issues Macro in Fabric would have the same feature richness as the TinyMCE one.
fields.summary: Improve Fabric editor Jira Issues Macro to allow more customisation options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page from Confluence, the cursor will be called in a random place when Contrast Ratio Checker is enabled.

h3. Environment

* Fabric
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Installed Contrast Ratio Checker extension from Chrome
# Edit the page from Confluence using Fabric editor
# Noticed that the cursor is being called to a random place. 

h3. Expected Results
The cursor should be placed from on the desired section. 

h3. Actual Results
The cursor being called to random places.

{noformat}
"inner callback called" this function being called non-stop from the browser console. 
{noformat}
h3. Notes
 Would interested to know how to cater to the scenario from our end. 
h3. Workaround

Disable the extension
fields.summary: Editing in Fabric causing the cursor to call in random place when Contrast Ratio Checker is enabled.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to @mention users in any Confluence page, it doesn't work. This only happens for *specific users* in the instance.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to reproduce 
# Create a new default page 
# @mention users

h3. Expected behavior 
Confluence should allow users to @mention any active user that has access to the application.

h3. Workaround
Disable and enable Confluence application access for the user you cannot @mention. 

*OR* use _[~nameoftheuser_ instead of _@_.
fields.summary: Cannot @mention specific users in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
{{GET /wiki/rest/api/template/blueprint}} REST API stopped working on some instances and returns status 500.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call [Get blueprint teamplates|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-template-blueprint-get] REST API

h3. Expected Results
Should receive status code 200 with an array of blueprint templates

h3. Actual Results
Received status code 500 with error message: 
{code}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No PageTemplate found for ContentTemplateRef: 0:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-business-blueprints:pp-content
{code}

h3. Notes
* Consistently happens in some instances, but works fine with other instances
* Used to work fine on the instances before
* Could successfully call {{GET /rest/api/template/page}}
* Experienced in the following instances:
** https://wilson-lai.atlassian.net
** https://yoonkeansiaw.atlassian.net
** https://ucchishta5.atlassian.net

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Get blueprint templates REST API fails with status 500

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Calling [Convert content body|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-contentbody-convert-to-post] then expanding {{webresource.superbatch.uris.css}} and {{webresource.uris.css}} does not include {{date-past}}, {{date-future}}, and {{date-upcoming}} classes. These classes are needed in order to make the date fields look consistent in view mode. Requesting that it will be made available for 3rd-party macros to use.

h3. Actual Results
Edit mode:  
!Edit Mode.png|thumbnail! 
View mode: 
!View Mode.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a new image to a page and using the *link* option to the same, depending on which option that you select to link the image (e.g. Recently viewed, search, advanced, web link) the app will open the image, instead of the link. If the user uses the option to include a web link, the image will not be displayed in the app.

h3. Environment
Tested with the Confluence Cloud app in an Android system.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Confluence, create a new page and add an image to the same.
# While still editing the page, make sure to tap on the image and use the *Link* option. You can also select the image with the cursor and use the link option from the editor toolbar.
# Publish the page
# Now, access Confluence with the Confluence Cloud app

h3. Expected Results
For a web link, the image should be displayed. For other options of linking, it should open the link, instead of the image.

h3. Actual Results
For a web link, nothing is displayed where the image is supposed to be. For other links, it opens the image.

h3.Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround for this behavior. A new one will be added once found.
fields.summary: Links in images will not work in Confluence Cloud App

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Excel file containing many columns will be broken into multiple pages when viewing it on a Confluence page
h3. Environment
 * Excel File with many columns

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Excel file (.xlsx) with many columns, e.g 26 (or use the provided file [^Atlassian Test - Excel.xlsx])
 # Upload this file into a page (by clicking *+* menu > Insert Files and Images)
 # Select the file and publish the page;
 # Click the file on the page to view it
 
OR

 # Create a new Excel file (.xlsx) with many columns, e.g 26 (or use the provided file [^Atlassian Test - Excel.xlsx])
 # Upload this file into a page (by clicking *+* menu > Insert Files and Images)
 # Insert the macro Office Excel to preview the file

h3. Expected Results
 * Sheet to be displayed correctly, displaying all columns into a single page, as the original file;

h3. Actual Results
 * Sheet is broken into multiple pages when viewing it in Confluence
 !Screen Recording 2019-06-20 at 04.56 PM.gif|width=500!

h3. Notes

This also happens when the excel macro is used to display the file.
h3. Workaround
 # Upload the file to google drive
 # Use the macro provided by our [Google Drive for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on
fields.summary: Excel file with many columns broken into multiple pages when previewing it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to upload files larger than 50MB by using the [Attachments macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html], the same will not be uploaded and no error messages will be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a Confluence administrator, go to *Settings* > *General Configuration* and change the maximum file size to a number higher than 50 MB.
 # Insert an Attachments macro to a page. The *File-list* template can be used as an example, as the same will automatically insert the macro into the page.
 # Click at *Browse Files* or *Drag and drop* the file to the Attachment macro field. Just make sure to select a file with 50MB+ size.

h3. Expected Results
The file should be uploaded, or, a message including an error should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The file isn't uploaded and no errors are displayed in the UI, besides only having a spinning wheel displayed near the option to upload files.

!spinning.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 Two workarounds can be used:

* Simply drag and drop the file to the page, while the same is published (not in edit mode). This will use a different method to have the upload completed.
* Edit the page and use the *insert files and images* option to upload the attachment.
fields.summary: Attaching larger files are failing if uploaded through Attachments Macro

fields.description:
This feature was presented a short time ago on the old editing experience. Nowadays, it was removed on the new editing experience as well as on the old one. 

It might be awesome to have it back, as it makes our life easier editing pages! :D
fields.summary: Open the editing mode from where you are landed on a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to archive a personal space via the REST API only using the status:archive you're prompted with the following: 
 Cannot change space type from personal to global or vice versa
h3. Environment

*Confluence Cloud personal space
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or locate a personal space
 # Make a REST API call to the following endpoint:
 ## 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/space/\{spaceKey}'
 # Send the following to set the space to archived:
 ## '\{"status": "archived"}'
  

h3. Expected Results

The personal space should change to archived.
h3. Actual Results

You're presented with the following error:
 'Cannot change space type from personal to global or vice versa'

 
h3. Workaround

Use the same endpoint but send the following to archive the space within the data:
 '\{“type”: “personal”, “status": "archived"}'
fields.summary: Archiving personal spaces via REST API yields error

fields.description: Currently, when a ticket is moved from one project to another, it would be very difficult to keep track of the historic data for the custom field from the new project.
fields.summary: Ability to retrieve historical data from JQL for Jira issue macro.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Around ~25 instances are sending {{page_viewed}}, {{page_updated}} webhooks to [Page View Analytics for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218023/page-view-analytics-for-confluence-cloud] for the past few weeks. Today alone, vendor has received 100+ from a single instance and total of 2.3M since the customer deactivated them.

h3. Expected Results
Unlicensed accounts should not have state ENABLED in License API response and we should not receive webhooks from them

h3. Actual Results
Getting state ENABLED in License API response and getting webhooks from these accounts.

h3. Notes
* Personally wasn't able to replicate. I think you'd need to have a licensed app to replicate this
* Actual instances and requests added as an internal comment

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Vendors receiving webhooks from instances where app's already uninstalled/deactivated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment when using the browser's print feature (CTRL+P), the following ID's and classes are included:

- id="content-header-container"
- id="likes-and-labels-container"
- class="class="page-metadata-modification-info"


h3. Suggested Solution
Hide/Remove the ID and classes so it would only show the content of the page

h3. Why this is important
It would be way faster and efficient to use the print feature without having to export it to PDF. By hiding such ID and classes, the page will look more like a proper document

h3. Workaround 
Use the PDF or Word export
fields.summary: Page in print CSS mode to be more document-like

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a file (e.g: Excel sheet) using the Companion app, the file becomes unclickable/unusable not allowing users to open it or download it from the page. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud
Companion App (Windows and MacOS)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Companion App
# Add an Excel file to a page in Confluence and publish it 
# Click on *Attachments* > Select the file and click on *Edit with*
# Choose Excel
# Make changes to the file and hit *Update* in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The file should be updated successfully allowing users to view and download it.

h3. Actual Results
The file becomes unclickable not allowing users to open it or download it from the page. 

h3. Workaround
Click on *Attachments* and then *View* next to the file.
fields.summary: File becomes unusable after editing it with Companion app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating Jira Report Blueprint in *advanced* mode does not work in Fabric editor. The query works fine in Jira but doesn't pull any record in the report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Jira Report Blueprint.
 # Click on *Switch to advanced*
 # Specify a query which works in Jira
 # Create the report, publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

Page is created and shows actual number and list of Jira issues as pulled by the query.

!Screen Shot 2019-06-19 at 5.39.52 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The page is created but Jira Report Blueprint doesn't show/pull the data from Jira. Shows Zero records.

!Screen Shot 2019-06-19 at 5.42.31 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This behavior only reproducible in new fabric editor.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Report Blueprint - specifying a query doesn't work in fabric editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The page restriction shows can edit for admin users with view restriction even though they can't actually edit the page

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a page restriction to a page
# grant yourself on view restriction.
# Click the padlock icon again to restrict the page
# User name shows with can edit permission

h3. Expected Results
Only can view permission should be shown to the user

h3. Actual Results
User see can edit permission granted even though they dont have the access

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Once we insert the People Directory link on a page, if you click over the link you are redirected to a Page Not Found.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a page;
# Insert the People Directory link on it (https://<site_name>.atlassian.net/people/search
# Publish the page and click over the link.

h3. Expected Results
You are redirected to the People Directory page of your instance.

h3. Actual Results
You are redirected to a Page Not Found on Confluence.

h3. Workaround
Instead of left-clicking over the link, right-click on that and open the link in a new tab

OR

For Macbooks: COMMAND + Left Click over the link
For Windows: CTRL + Left Click over the link
fields.summary: When insert the People Directory URL on a page, accessing it redirects you to a Page Not Found

fields.description:
When copying and pasting the content into Confluence, depending on what is being pasted, Confluence can sometimes face issues to have it inserted in the editor and it will avoid the page to be published with messages like the following:

{quote}
Unable to communicate with the server. Saving is not possible at the moment.
{quote}

While this confirms that the editor is having issues, it points out that a communication issue might be happening, but, indeed, after removing the specific incompatible content, the user will be able to publish the page. 

Previously, with the *Legacy editor*, this message was displayed because of examples like [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58745] or [this bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32474] would show messages like this. On the new editor, a tested example was with an incompatible media (that only shows as *InlineExtension*, and while editing, *inline-media*) would trigger the same issue.

This is a suggestion to provide a message stating that specific content is not compatible with the editor and it must be removed/edited. This way, it would help the user on finding and mitigating the possible root cause.
fields.summary: Improve message for content incompatibility in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to edit a page that you actually have permission in the space and it is restricted to edit for your user, the pencil icon (edit option) is not visible. Then, if you try to access the restrictions on the page (padlock icon) and try to remove and add your user again, the below error is shown:

!image-2019-06-18-09-41-39-977.png|width=431,height=119!

"Error
There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later"
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This issue actually is very inconsistent. We, from the Atlassian Support, could not find how to reproduce this issue so far, although we have a workaround.

Also, the browser console doesn't log anything when applying the change on the restrictions, and the network tab shows everything working fine, so far. However, that's how we face this weird behavior:
 # Access a page that you actually have rights to edit;
 # If the edit icon is gone, click on the padlock icon;
 # Perform a dummy change in the page restrictions and save it.

h3. Expected Results

You got your page restrictions changed according to what you just did.
h3. Actual Results

The mentioned error appears and you still cannot edit the page.
h3. Workaround

If you are the space admin:
 # Go to *Space Settings > Permissions > Restricted pages*;
 # Find the page you are looking for and click over the *padlock icon*;
 # From the *Page Information* page, click over the *ellipses* (right top side of the page) and select *Restrictions*;
 # Perform a dummy change and the page is editable again.

h3. Notes

Some customers are reporting that once you apply this workaround if you were to navigate to another page, and then go back to the affected page, you will find that you need to apply the workaround again in order to edit the page.
fields.summary: Error when applying page restrictions

fields.description:
In Jira, we have an option to import and export attachment separately, however, similar features are not available in Confluence Cloud and Server. Having such a feature will help customer to first migrate the data and then later plan for multiple imports of the attachment as the larger the size of the XML file is the larger the time take to complete the migration. 

With the help of the above feature, customer can break the attachments into multiple chunks and then plan for a separate attachment migration. 

 

In the past, we have seen multiple instances in Confluence server to Cloud migration were while using CMAC for migration, the data gets migrated to cloud but the attachment fails to migrate and the workaround is to perform the import again, which is again a time-consuming solution. If we have a workaround or a feature that has the ability to perform the separate attachment import and export in Confluence.
fields.summary: Request for having separate export and import for data and attachment in Confluence cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

When attempting to access a Confluence Cloud site whilst logged in to Atlassian account with a user who has access to that site but no access to Confluence results in a "request access" page. Logging out means you can access the site in anonymous mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get a user with access to an Atlassian site but no access to Confluence
 # Enable anonymous access for some Confluence site
 # Attempt to navigate to that site 

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to view public content on that site, the same as an anonymous user.
h3. Actual Results

You land on a "request access" page

 
h3. Workaround

Logging out allows anonymous access, however this will log you out of all Atlassian account products.
fields.summary: Accessing a Confluence instance, with anonymous access enabled, as a logged in user with no access to Confluence sends you to a request access screen

fields.description: I used to be able to put a small table within a table cell or in one step of a procedure. Now I can't.  How else am I supposed to put an If/Then table as part of a step by step procedure? Or field options in one cell of a table? Taking things out of the editor is not making my job any easier.
fields.summary: Bring back nested tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the old editing experience, when a file was dragged and dropped to a page in viewing mode, once we go to edit it, after clicking on the *Files & Images*, the file was listed there. This is not the same behavior that happens on the new editor, although it seems that the file is being uploaded to the pge.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a published page on the new editing experience;
# Drag and drop any file/image in attachments.
# After the upload is done, access the editing mode of this page;
# Go to attach a file.

h3. Expected Results
The previously uploaded file is listed on the *Recent uploaded* list.

h3. Actual Results
The file is not listed in the *Recent uploaded* list, so we must upload it again.

h3. Notes
Although the file is not listed in the Recent Uploaded list, it is listed in the Attachments (Page > Ellipses > Attachments)

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot add files from viewing mode

fields.description: This suggestion tracks interest for the ability to nest Expand macros inside a table. For the ability to nest bodied macros in other bodied macros, see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-68323.
fields.summary: Ability to nest Expand macros inside Tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a custom favicon is uploaded in Confluence it errors out.
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence administration, navigate to *Look and feel* > *Site Logo and Favicon*
 # Upload a custom image in favicon
 # Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

The updated favicon should show up in the sidebar(Logo gets updated)
h3. Actual Results

The uploaded favicon doesn't show in the sidebar and throws below error
{code:java}
Oops - an error has occurred
System Error
A system error has occurred — our apologies!

For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base for a solution.

If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system with the following information:

a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
a copy of the error and system information found below
a copy of the application logs (if possible).
Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage...{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to change favicon in Confluence

fields.description:
Page layout of the new editor should be configurable.

Example- Title and the whole page alignment could be set as 'Left/Right' instead of only 'center' as per the requirement.

Bring back the features on the old layout tool to the New Page Editor, which includes:

Add/remove section
Move section Up/Down
The ability to create one column

h3. Issue Summary
If the user is editing a page and the network connection is lost, most of the times the new editor won't show the warning pop-up message.
This presents a high impact to the customer since they won't be notified when there's no connection to the server, which can cause data loss.

 # Edit a page (new editor)
 # Disable the network connection

h3. Expected Results
The *Publish* button is disabled and a warning is shown informing it can't save changes:
| !offline_warning.gif|width=800! |

h3. Actual Results
Most of the times, no warning is shown:
|  !offline_no_warning.gif|width=800! !  |

h3. Notes
The warning message was only shown after a lot of attempts.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we have an anchor link on a page, if we copy this page the anchor link text gets changed to "_Copy of <page title>#Anchor_" instead of keep as "_#Anchor_"

This behavior was discovered troubleshooting a similar issue with anchors, where the same behavior happens but in existing pages (the anchor link suddenly changes from "_#Anchor_" to "_<page title>#anchor_"). Fixing the reproducible case should fix this one as well.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Old Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with some _[lorem ipslum|https://www.lipsum.com/]_ stuff;
# On the middle of the page, insert an anchor called "nuts", for example;
# On the top of the page, insert an anchor link called "go nuts" and link it to "nuts";
# Publish this page;
# Create a copy of this page.

h3. Expected Results
The copied page changes only its name (Copy of <page title>).

h3. Actual Results
The page gets the anchor text link changed to "_Copy of <page title>#go nuts_"

h3. Notes
* The other mentioned behavior, as already said, could not be reproducible so far. The workaround is applied for both cases.
* This behavior is also reproducible on already published pages when adding new anchor links.

h3. Workaround
Access the anchor link and delete the content before the *#* on the text link field.
fields.summary: Anchor links change the link text when copying pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment


 * New editor, plain text macros FF turned on
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any Confluence space where the "The new editing experience gives you better looking pages, and new features like live macros." appears at the top.
 # Click the "Try it on a new page" link
 # Give the new page a title, then in the page body type "{{/sequence"}} and select the Sequence diagram macro.
 # {color:#de350b}At this point, note that in the browser console that there is already a 404 error trying to fetch the URL {{https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/:pageid/history/:historyid/macro/id/:macroid}}{color}
 # Click the pencil icon to open the "Edit `Sequence diagram` macro" dialog
 # In the Content textarea on the right-hand side, enter the following text:  {{A->B: test}}
 # Click "Save" to close the dialog.
 # {color:#de350b}At this point, note that we have another similar 404 error;  AND the live preview does not show (just a big grey box where the macro should be).{color}
 # Click "Publish" to publish the page.
 # When the page renders, the macro appears correctly (albeit with the grey artifact on the right hand side, as per CONFCLOUD-66806)

h3. Expected Results

Macros should render normally on editor.
h3. Actual Results

There is a 404 error in console and the live preview does not show (just a big grey box where the macro should be).
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Summary
When creating a new page with the [new editor experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], the macro preview is shown as blank so user can't add details(e.g. select Jira projects, filters)  to add Jira gadgets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Try to insert a Jira gadget (e.g Jira Issue Calendar, Jira Roadmap, Issue Statistics and Issues in progress) into the page

h3. Expected Results
In the macro edit window, user is able to choose Jira projects and filters

h3. Actual Results
The macro preview is shown as blank and user can't choose Jira projects or filters
 
h3. Notes
* This happens both regardless of the page status(draft/publish) or how the macro was added("/", Insert menu)
* This does not happen with the Legacy Editor
* Confirmed macros that don't work:
** Pie Chart
** Version Report
** Voted Issues
** Watched Issues
** Jira Issues Calendar
** Jira Road Map
** Issue Statistics
** Issues in progress
** Created vs. Resolved Chart
** Sprint Burndown Gadget
** Average Age Chart
** Average Time in Status
** Average Number of Times in Status
** Filter Results

h3. Workaround
Currently, there's no workaround found for this issue.

fields.description:
h1. Use case

As I user working in a company with multiple distinct confluence instances, I would like to do perform:
 * Cross instance linking
 * Cross instance attachment use (i.e. for images)
 * Cross instance macro usage
 ** Task reporting (_Task report_ macro)
 ** Page properties reporting (_Page properties report_ macro)
 ** _Page tree_ macro
 ** Cross instance page excerpts (_Excerpt Include_ macro)
 ** Basically all macros that do report

h1. Precedence

This use case for Jira to Jira, Confluence to Jira and Jira to Confluence is already supported as all these cases support multiple instances with regards to integration
h1. User interest

I have collected already existing questions for this requirement on Atlassian forum under the label [confluence-to-confluence-integration|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/tag/confluence-to-confluence-integration/tg-p]

Also, CONFSERVER-24425 relates to this very same use case, but it was closed as answered, and the linked issue that is a follow up is a broken link
fields.summary: Confluence to Confluence integration (different instances)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Page Tree macro allows you to set "@self" and "@home" as a parameter in the "Root Page" field, however when you start typing "@s" or "@h" the field displays and error saying "Not found".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add the Page Tree macro
# In the "Root Page" field type "@self" or "@home"

h3. Expected Results
No error should be displayed since this is a valid parameter.
h3. Actual Results

The field displays a "Not found" error message.

 !Screen Shot 2019-06-11 at 16.50.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This field usually returns page titles as you start typing some letters, but since it can't find any page which title starts with "@s" or "@h" it returns the error message.
h3. Workaround

The macro can still be used as you can finish typing "@self" or "@home" and click the "Save" button, ignoring the error message, and after the page is published it should display the page tree accordingly.
fields.summary: @self and @home in the Page Tree macro root page display a "Not found" error

 !Screen Shot 2019-06-11 at 14.24.17.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Confluence user with application access creates and/or edits a page on Confluence Cloud its profile picture and name are displayed below the page title.
Each user with an Atlassian Account now have an option to mark their profile picture private (Only visible to the user), or only visible to their organization, or public visible.
But it you set the visibility of your profile picture to be visible only to you, and an anonymous user browse a page that you created/edited in Confluence Cloud, this anonymous user can view your profile picture.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a page in Confluence Cloud site
# Go to Atlassian Account privacy settings (https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility) and set your profile picture to be visible only to you
# On Confluence Cloud make the page you created/edited publicly accessible by anonymous user
# Open the page using your browser's incognito/private mode to view this page as anonymous

h3. Expected Results
The profile picture of the user that created/edited the page shouldn't be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The profile picture of the user that created/edited the page is showing to anonymous users, even though this user set its profile picture to be visible only to them.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Anonymous users can view the profile picture of who created/edited a page regardless of their privacy settings

h3. Issue Summary

Users see a message *Page Not Found* when clicking a link of user's name in the *Recently Updated* macro with the *social* theme.

h3. Enviroment

It happens to both:

* Fabric ([The new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html]), and
* TinyMCE

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Place the *Recently Updated* macro and select the *social* theme
**  !Screenshot 2019-06-11 11.12.25.png|thumbnail!  
# Publish the page
# Click the link of listed users in the published page
**  !Screenshot 2019-06-11 11.19.15.png|thumbnail! 
# Some of the links redirect you to the *Page Not Found*
** !Screenshot 2019-06-11 11.14.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

All links in the macro correctly work and redirect you to People page.

h3. Actual Results

You see a page saying *Page Not Found* and an error below in the browser console:

{code:none}
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of null
{code}

 !Screenshot 2019-06-11 11.14.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

Until then,

* Reload the page
* Open the link with a new tab
fields.summary: Some links don't work in the Recently Updated macro

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

Pasting Anchor link in the address bar of the browser does not redirect the user to the precise location of the Anchor IF *Page Title or the HyperLink* contains even a single alphabet of any language other than English.

(the Anchor and Link exists on the same Page)

 Example- прослушиваний *OR* title-п *OR* title1 提 *OR* title2ÄÖÜ etc.

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud- Old Editor(TinyMCE)

 

*Steps to Reproduce*

Step 1- Create a page and the Page Title could be in any language but English (Page Title must contain at least one alphabet of a language other than English).

Step 2- Create Text Link and a respective Anchor. And publish the Page.

Step 3- Click on the Text Link(Associated with an Anchor on the same page) and copy its link address.

Step 4- Paste the copied link address in a browser address bar.

Step 5- The page will reload but not take you (user) to the precise location of the Anchor in the Page.

 

*Expected Results*

The user must be redirected to the precise location of the Anchor.

*Actual Results*

The Page gets reloaded but the user does not get to the precise location of the Anchor.
h3. Workaround
Remove the alphabet from another language(from the title), make sure that the title only contains English alphabets.
fields.summary: Anchor Link does not redirect the user to the Anchor location in a Page when address link is copy-pasted in the address bar(old editor)
